subject: Simsonn pro x ultra base plate
description_text:
Hello,

I hope this finds you well.  I just received the simsonn pro x ultra with
the heel plate and base plate. I install on my rig and notice the base
plate flexes when using the brake pedal.  The front part of pedal pulls the
plate upwards.  I took a short video which I upload here.
https://youtube.com/shorts/mfBWwtOesQU?si=yJBF7ZkEQKB-L3oz

Let me know if you need me to send video other way.

I believe the thickness of base plate is too thin for the brake pressure
and bends easily. Please advise if there is any way to fix this. Thank you
for your help.

Chris

conversations.body_text: Hi ProHitman21,     There are multiple screw holes designed at the bottom. Please try installing two additional screws in the areas marked with the red circles.

Hi,

I was able to mount the pedals directly without the base plate.

I am trying to setup the pedals and my wheel in iracing but the position
keeps moving around and preventing setup.  I did the calibration on simsonn
manager v 2.1.0 and it was successful. I also tried adding ferrite clamps
to everything and connecting pedals directly to pc but I still have the
jittery inputs. Can you please advise if this is grounding or emi issue in
pedals? I also tried isolating the control box with no change.

Please check the short video showing the jittery input.

https://youtube.com/shorts/CZPW6QSUvO0?si=ogPPKMcVCunZpJ-0

Thank you for your help.


On Thu, Jul 24, 2025, 6:49 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi ProHitman21,  In the “Settings - Update” section, click “Manual Firmware Update,” then navigate to the pedals-firmware folder → pedals folder → and select the proxultra.sfu file to update. This firmware will disable the 4th axis.      Using the VKB tool, if the Rx axis is not visible, it means the issue has been resolved. Normally, only the X, Y, and Z axes should be present.
